segment.source: Streaming media assessment set up a remote server
segment.target: Streaming media assessment set up a remote server

segment.source: Streaming media assessment set up a remote server
segment.target: Streaming media assessment set up a remote server

segment.source: Streaming media assessment: set up a remote server
segment.target: Streaming media assessment: set up a remote server

segment.source: The Streaming Media Performance assessment includes an option to run the assessment on 2 computers.
segment.target: The Streaming Media Performance assessment includes an option to run the assessment on 2 computers.

segment.source: In this scenario, an HTTP streaming server application that's installed on a second or remote computer streams content to the computer that's running the assessment.
segment.target: In this scenario, an HTTP streaming server application that's installed on a second or remote computer streams content to the computer that's running the assessment.

segment.source: This topic describes how to set up the streaming server.
segment.target: This topic describes how to set up the streaming server.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Any computer that has the Windows Assessment Toolkit installed can act as a streaming server and can provide the media files that were installed via the Windows Assessment Toolkit to any requesting client.
segment.target: Any computer that has the Windows Assessment Toolkit installed can act as a streaming server and can provide the media files that were installed via the Windows Assessment Toolkit to any requesting client.

segment.source: For this assessment, a workload is a .mp4 file and a corresponding .html file that the assessment uses together as streaming media.
segment.target: For this assessment, a workload is a .mp4 file and a corresponding .html file that the assessment uses together as streaming media.

segment.source: For example, 720p.mp4 and 720p.html together form a 720p workload.
segment.target: For example, 720p.mp4 and 720p.html together form a 720p workload.

segment.source: To use those media workloads in your 2-computer assessment scenario, complete the following steps.
segment.target: To use those media workloads in your 2-computer assessment scenario, complete the following steps.

segment.source: To set up a server for the Streaming Media Performance assessment
segment.target: To set up a server for the Streaming Media Performance assessment

segment.source: On the remote server, install the Windows Assessment Toolkit.
segment.target: On the remote server, install the Windows Assessment Toolkit.

segment.source: For instructions, see Windows Assessment Console step-by-step guide or Windows Assessment Services step-by-step guide.
segment.target: For instructions, see Windows Assessment Console step-by-step guide or Windows Assessment Services step-by-step guide.

segment.source: Open a command prompt.
segment.target: Open a command prompt.

segment.source: Depending on the computer type, browse to the StreamingMediaAssessmentServer.exe file:
segment.target: Depending on the computer type, browse to the StreamingMediaAssessmentServer.exe file:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The preceding paths assume that you have installed the Windows Assessment Toolkit in its default location.
segment.target: The preceding paths assume that you have installed the Windows Assessment Toolkit in its default location.

segment.source: For an x86-based computer, type this:
segment.target: For an x86-based computer, type this:

segment.source: For an x64-based computer, type this:
segment.target: For an x64-based computer, type this:

segment.source: At the command prompt, type this:
segment.target: At the command prompt, type this:

segment.source: The following table describes the parameters in the preceding command-line text.
segment.target: The following table describes the parameters in the preceding command-line text.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: ContentPathpath_to_streaming_content
segment.target: ContentPathpath_to_streaming_content

segment.source: Type the path that contains the media and corresponding HTML pages that the server will stream.
segment.target: Type the path that contains the media and corresponding HTML pages that the server will stream.

segment.source: By default, this path is:
segment.target: By default, this path is:

segment.source: You can specify an absolute path for the media and corresponding HTML pages.
segment.target: You can specify an absolute path for the media and corresponding HTML pages.

segment.source: PopulateCachefile_name_list
segment.target: PopulateCachefile_name_list

segment.source: Type the file names that the server will cache into memory.
segment.target: Type the file names that the server will cache into memory.

segment.source: List all files, separated by commas.
segment.target: List all files, separated by commas.

segment.source: This example contains the media files that the assessment uses by default:
segment.target: This example contains the media files that the assessment uses by default:

segment.source: The assessment searches for all these file names in the path that the setting has specified.
segment.target: The assessment searches for all these file names in the path that the setting has specified.

segment.source: If any of the files aren't present, the assessment logs a missing file event, but the assessment continues to run the normal process by using files that it finds in the path.
segment.target: If any of the files aren't present, the assessment logs a missing file event, but the assessment continues to run the normal process by using files that it finds in the path.

segment.source: Portnumber
segment.target: Portnumber

segment.source: Specify a port if you don't want to use the default of port 80.
segment.target: Specify a port if you don't want to use the default of port 80.

segment.source: The default port may or may not be specified on the client.
segment.target: The default port may or may not be specified on the client.

segment.source: If you must use a different port number, make sure that you specify it on both the remote server and the client.
segment.target: If you must use a different port number, make sure that you specify it on both the remote server and the client.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Before specifying which port to use, verify that Windows Firewall is not blocking communication.
segment.target: Before specifying which port to use, verify that Windows Firewall is not blocking communication.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Firewall from start to finish.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Firewall from start to finish.

segment.source: The PopulateCache list of files shown previously is the default set of files that the assessment uses as workloads.
segment.target: The PopulateCache list of files shown previously is the default set of files that the assessment uses as workloads.

segment.source: The local computer where you run the Streaming Media Performance assessment requests these files from the remote server during the assessment process.
segment.target: The local computer where you run the Streaming Media Performance assessment requests these files from the remote server during the assessment process.

segment.source: The remote server caches any file that the PopulateCache parameter has specified and provides them to the local computer for performance measurement.
segment.target: The remote server caches any file that the PopulateCache parameter has specified and provides them to the local computer for performance measurement.
